data.title: Paella
data.description: A Spanish rice dish made with seafood, meats, and vegetables, flavored with saffron
ingredients: 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil (80 ml)
1/2 tsp sweet smoked Spanish paprika (1.30 grams)
1/4 tsp saffron threads or powder (.17 grams)
instructions: Rouchly chop 3 cloves of garlic, finely dice 1/2 onion, finely chop 1/2 red bell pepper and cut 1 cleaned tube of squid into small squares

Heat a paella pan with a medium-high heat and add in 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil, after 1 minute season the olive oil with sea salt and add in the cut squid, mix with the olive oil and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes, then remove from the pan and set aside, then add in the diced onion & chopped garlic into the pan, mix with the olive oil, after 1 minute add in the chopped bell pepper and continue to mix so everything evenly sautees

After 3 minutes, add in 1/2 cup tomato sauce and season everything with 1/2 tsp sweet smoked paprika, sea salt & black pepper, mix together, after 2 minutes and the tomato sauce has thickened, add the squid back into the pan, mix together, then add in 2 1/2 cups fish broth and the saffron

Once the broth comes to a boil add in 1 cup round rice, give it one final mix so everything is evenly distributed, after 5 to 6 minutes add in the shrimp and the cleaned mussels, after another 5 minutes, lower the fire to a low-medium heat and simmer until all the broth has been absorbed by the rice, then hit back to a medium-high heat to achieve the socarrat, just go between 1 to 2 minutes, then remove the pan from the heat and cover
After 5 minutes uncover the pan, and garnish the paella with lemon wedges and finely chopped parsley, enjoy!

data.title: Som tam
data.description: a spicy salad that is made from shredded green and firm papaya
ingredients: 2 cups of shredded green papaya (or swede/rutabaga)
1-2 fresh birds eye chili (or more depending on tolerance)
1-2 tbs Thai snake beans (or green beans)
instructions: Roughly crush a small handful of unsalted peanuts with mortar and pestle. Set aside. Wipe the mortar and pestle clean
Melt palm sugar in a small pan at low or medium heat, adding 2 tbs of water. The cooking process should form a shiny and thick syrup. This makes it easier to mix the sugar with the salad

Peel the papaya (or swede), shred it with a shredder (or a mandolin slicer) to thin strips and soak them in cold water while you prepare the rest of the salad. This makes the papaya crunchier and gets rid of any excess starch from the swede
Cut the green beans into one-inch pieces. Throw away the endings

Take the chilies and peeled garlic and give them a gentle bash with mortar and pestle. You still ought to see bits and pieces, not a puree. Add the shrimp and continue bashing. Add the crushed peanuts and mix well

Add the shredded papaya and continue bashing, but not too hard. Just enough so the mixture soaks up the flavours. Use a bigger spoon as a support tool, that way you can shift the salad in the mortar and it doesn't fall out while bashing and mixing
Add the liquid palm sugar, tomatoes, beans, lime juice and fish sauce. Continue to lightly bash, shift with the spoon, and mix a little more
Serve on a big dish or bowl, sprinkle some crushed peanuts on top! Voila!

data.title: Beef Tacos
data.description: mexican street food with seasoned beef, fresh toppings, and wrapped in soft tortillas
instructions: Cook beef in 10-inch skillet over medium heat 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until brown; drain
Stir salsa into beef. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly; reduce heat to medium-low. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour beef mixture into large serving bowl; cover to keep warm
Heat taco shells as directed on package. Serve taco shells with beef mixture, lettuce, tomato and cheese

data.title: Chicken parmesan
data.description: Italian dish with breaded chicken cutlets, marinara sauce, and melted cheese
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 cup panko bread crumbs, or more as needed
0.75 of cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more if needed
1.5 cup olive oil for frying, or as needed
0.25 cup fresh mozzarella, cut into small cubes
instructions: Gather the ingredients. Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)

Place chicken breasts between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2-inch
Season chicken thoroughly with salt and pepper. Using a sifter or strainer; sprinkle flour over chicken breasts, evenly coating both sides

Beat eggs in a shallow bowl and set aside. Mix bread crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a separate bowl, set aside. Dip a flour-coated chicken breast in beaten eggs. Transfer breast to the bread crumb mixture, pressing crumbs into both sides. Repeat for each breast. Let chicken rest for 10 to 15 minutes

Heat 1/2 inch olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Cook chicken in the hot oil until golden, about 2 minutes per side. The chicken will finish cooking in the oven

Transfer chicken to a baking dish. Top each breast with 2 tablespoons tomato sauce. Layer each chicken breast with equal amounts of mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and provolone cheese. Sprinkle remaining Parmesan over top and drizzle each with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil

Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
serve

data.title: Iskender Kebab
data.description: Turkish dish with lamb or beef served over pita, topped with tomato sauce and yogurt
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced meat and cook until browned on both sides
Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, and red pepper flakes (if using) to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly
While the sauce is cooking, lightly toast the pita breads
To assemble the Iskender kebab, place a pita bread on a plate. Top with some of the cooked meat and sauce. Drizzle with melted butter and a dollop of plain yogurt
Serve immediately

data.title: Crêpes Suzette
data.description: French dessert crêpes served with a citrusy orange sauce and flambéed with liqueur
ingredients: 25g melted butter, plus extra for cooking
50ml Grand Marnier or other orange liqueur (optional)
instructions: Make the crêpe batter: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, milk, eggs, sugar, and salt until smooth. Stir in the melted butter
Heat a lightly buttered crêpe pan or skillet over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan and swirl to create a thin, even crêpe. Cook for 1-2 minutes per side, or until golden brown
Repeat with the remaining batter
Make the sauce: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sugar, orange juice, and orange zest. Cook until the sugar dissolves and the sauce thickens slightly
Fold each crêpe into quarters and add them to the skillet with the sauce. Cook for a few minutes, basting the crêpes with the sauce, until they are heated through
If using Grand Marnier, carefully pour it over the crêpes and flambé (ignite with a long match or lighter)
Serve the Crêpes Suzette immediately

data.title: Pad Thai
data.description: Popular Thai stir-fried noodle dish with tofu, shrimp, peanuts, and tamarind sauce
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 15-20 minutes, or until softened
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and chili (if using) and stir-fry for 30 seconds
Add tofu and shrimp/chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes
Push the ingredients to one side of the wok and pour in the egg. Scramble the egg and then mix it with the other ingredients
Add the soaked noodles, bean sprouts, fish sauce, soy sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the noodles are heated through and the sauce has thickened
Garnish with chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro. Serve immediately with lime wedges

data.title: Khinkali
data.description: Georgian dumplings filled with seasoned meat, herbs, and a flavorful broth
ingredients: 500g ground beef (or a mix of beef and pork)
Fresh cilantro or parsley, chopped (for garnish)
instructions: In a bowl, combine the ground meat, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper. Mix well and set aside
In a separate bowl, gradually add the warm water to the flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes
Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 3mm. Cut out circles using a glass or cookie cutter (about 10cm in diameter)
Place a spoonful of the meat filling in the center of each circle

Gather the edges of the dough and pleat them together to form a knot at the top, creating a pouch-like shape.  Try to make as many pleats as possible - this is part of the traditional look and helps hold the juices inside
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Carefully drop the khinkali into the boiling water, a few at a time. Cook for 8-10 minutes, or until they float to the surface and are cooked through
Remove the khinkali with a slotted spoon and serve hot. Garnish with chopped cilantro or parsley

data.title: Tacos al Pastor
data.description: mexican tacos made with marinated pork, pineapple, and fresh toppings
instructions: Rehydrate the dried chiles in hot water for 30 minutes
In a blender, combine the rehydrated chiles, apple cider vinegar, achiote paste, oregano, cumin, cloves, cinnamon, onion, and garlic. Blend until smooth
Marinate the pork in the chile mixture for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F)
Thread the marinated pork onto a vertical spit or arrange it on a baking sheet
Roast the pork for 1-1.5 hours, or until cooked through and slightly crispy
While the pork is roasting, grill the pineapple slices until slightly caramelized
To serve, slice the pork thinly and place it in warm tortillas. Top with grilled pineapple, chopped cilantro, and chopped white onion. Serve with lime wedges

data.title: Schnitzel
data.description: German dish of breaded and fried meat, typically served with potatoes and salad
instructions: Pound the cutlets with a meat mallet until they are about 1/4 inch thick
Season the cutlets with salt and pepper
Set up three shallow dishes: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs
Dredge each cutlet in flour, then dip in the beaten eggs, and finally coat with breadcrumbs, ensuring they are fully covered
Heat about 1/2 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Carefully place the breaded cutlets in the hot oil and fry for 3-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through
Remove the schnitzels from the skillet and drain on paper towels
Serve immediately with lemon wedges

data.title: Boeuf Bourguignon
data.description: Classic French beef stew braised in red wine with vegetables and aromatic herbs
ingredients: 1 kg beef stew meat, cut into 2-inch cubes
instructions: Preheat oven to 160°C (325°F)
Season the beef cubes with salt and pepper
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides
Remove the beef and set aside. Add the chopped onion, carrots, and garlic to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute more
Pour the red wine and beef broth into the pot, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom
Return the beef to the pot. Add the bouquet garni. Bring to a simmer, cover, and transfer to the oven
Cook for 2.5-3 hours, or until the beef is very tender

While the beef is cooking, prepare the pearl onions and mushrooms. In a separate skillet, melt some butter over medium heat. Add the pearl onions and cook until browned. Add the mushrooms and cook until softened
After the beef is cooked, remove the bouquet garni. Add the cooked pearl onions and mushrooms to the pot
Simmer for 15 minutes more to allow the flavors to meld
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot

data.title: Green Curry
data.description: thai curry made with green chilies, coconut milk, and a variety of meats or vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup chicken or tofu, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Heat coconut milk in a pot over medium heat until it starts to simmer
Add the green curry paste and stir well until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add the chicken or tofu and cook until it is cooked through
Add the bamboo shoots, green beans, Thai eggplant, and red bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender-crisp
Stir in the fish sauce and sugar. Simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld
Add the Thai basil leaves and lime juice. Stir well
Serve hot with rice

data.title: Fårikål
data.description: Lamb and Cabbage Stew
ingredients: 1 kg lamb shoulder or neck, cut into large pieces
1 large head of white cabbage, cut into wedges
instructions: In a large pot, layer the lamb pieces and cabbage wedges alternately
Add the water, peppercorns, and salt to the pot
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the lamb is very tender
If you want a thicker stew, mix the flour with a little cold water to form a slurry, then stir it into the stew during the last 15 minutes of cooking. Simmer until thickened
Serve the fårikål hot, directly from the pot

data.title: Plov (Pilaf)
data.description: rice dish cooked with meat, vegetables, and spices
ingredients: 500g lamb or beef, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Soak for at least 30 minutes
Heat the oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot (kazan) or Dutch oven over medium-high heat
Add the meat and brown on all sides. Remove the meat and set aside
Add the onions to the pot and cook until golden brown
Add the carrots and cook until softened
Return the meat to the pot. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Stir well
Add the soaked rice to the pot, spreading it evenly over the meat and vegetables. Do not stir
Pour in enough hot water to cover the rice by about 1 inch.  Place the whole head of garlic, unpeeled, in the center of the rice
Bring the water to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot tightly, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the liquid is absorbed
Remove the pot from the heat and let it rest, covered, for 10-15 minutes.  This is crucial for fluffy rice
Fluff the rice with a fork, being careful not to crush the grains.  Remove the head of garlic and serve the plov hot

data.title: Beef Stroganoff
data.description: Russian dish made with sautéed beef in a creamy mushroom sauce, served with noodles
ingredients: 500g beef tenderloin or sirloin, cut into strips
instructions: Season the beef strips with salt and pepper
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and sear on all sides until browned. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside
Add the onion to the skillet and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms and cook until browned
Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute
Gradually whisk in the beef broth, sour cream, and Dijon mustard. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce has thickened slightly
Return the beef to the skillet and stir to combine. Simmer for a few minutes to heat through
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot over noodles or rice

data.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
data.description: Indian curry with marinated chicken cooked in a spiced tomato sauce.
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
Rice or naan bread, for serving
instructions: Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, combine all the marinade ingredients. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight
Make the sauce: Heat the butter or ghee in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly golden
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute more
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, coconut milk, tomato paste, garam masala, paprika, and salt. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally
Add the marinated chicken to the sauce. Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread

data.title: Feijoada
data.description: Brazilian stew made with black beans, pork, and sausages, served with rice
instructions: Soak the black beans in cold water for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight. Drain and rinse the beans
In a large pot, combine the soaked beans, pork ribs, smoked sausage, dried beef, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and orange quarters

Add enough water to cover the ingredients by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for at least 2-3 hours, or until the beans are tender and the meats are cooked through. Stir occasionally
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove the orange quarters and bay leaves
Serve the feijoada hot, traditionally with white rice, collard greens, farofa, and orange slices

data.title: Harissa
data.description: Spicy North African chili paste made with peppers, garlic, and spices
ingredients: 500g boneless lamb or beef, cut into large chunks
instructions: Soak the pearl barley in cold water for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight. Drain and rinse the barley
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the lamb or beef and brown on all sides
Add the chopped onion to the pot and cook until softened
Add the soaked barley to the pot. Stir well

Add enough water or broth to cover the ingredients by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for at least 3-4 hours, or until the meat is very tender and the barley has thickened into a porridge-like consistency. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking
Season with salt and pepper to taste during the last hour of cooking
Serve the harissa hot

data.title: Qutab
data.description: Azerbaijani stuffed flatbread filled with herbs, meat, or cheese
ingredients: 1 cup finely chopped greens (spinach, cilantro, dill, parsley, etc.)
instructions: Make the dough: In a bowl, combine the flour and salt. Gradually add the warm water, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead for 5-7 minutes until smooth. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes
Prepare the filling: In a separate bowl, combine the chopped greens, feta cheese, onion, salt, and pepper. Mix well
Divide the dough into small balls (about 2 inches in diameter)
On a lightly floured surface, roll out each ball into a thin circle (about 6-8 inches in diameter)
Place a spoonful of the filling on one half of the circle, leaving a small border around the edge. Fold the other half of the circle over the filling to form a semi-circle
Press the edges of the qutab together to seal. You can use a fork to crimp the edges for a decorative touch
Heat a lightly buttered or oiled skillet over medium heat. Cook the qutabs for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through
Serve hot

data.title: Ropa Vieja
data.description: Shredded beef in tomato sauce
ingredients: 1.5 lbs flank steak or skirt steak
instructions: Season the flank steak with salt and pepper
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Sear the steak on all sides until browned. Remove the steak from the pot and set aside
Add the onion and bell peppers to the pot and cook until softened
Add the garlic, cumin, and oregano and cook for 1 minute more
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, and red wine (if using). Bring to a simmer
Return the steak to the pot. Add the bay leaves. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is very tender and easily shreds
Remove the beef from the pot and shred it using two forks
Return the shredded beef to the pot and stir to combine with the sauce
Serve the Ropa Vieja hot over cooked white rice

data.title: Beshbarmak
data.description: Kazakh dish of boiled meat served over noodles and topped with onions
ingredients: 500g beef or lamb, cut into large pieces
1 package (about 400g) dried noodles (like lasagna sheets or wide egg noodles)
instructions: In a large pot, place the beef or lamb and cover with water or broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the meat is very tender. Remove the meat from the pot and set aside (keep warm in the broth)
Add the sliced onions to the broth and cook for about 15-20 minutes, until softened and slightly caramelized
Add the potatoes to the broth and cook until tender, about 20-25 minutes
While the potatoes are cooking, cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse the noodles

To assemble the beshbarmak:  Traditionally, this is done on a large platter.  Place a layer of noodles on the platter. Top with some of the cooked potatoes and onions.  Arrange the pieces of meat over the vegetables.  Ladle some of the broth over the entire platter
Serve hot.  Traditionally, beshbarmak is eaten with the hands

data.title: Vegan Chili
data.description: Hearty, plant-based chili with beans, vegetables, and spices
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Toppings: chopped cilantro, vegan sour cream, avocado, etc
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Add the onion and bell pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
Add the garlic, jalapeno (if using), chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne (if using) and cook for 1 minute more
Stir in the black beans, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes, or longer for a deeper flavor. Stir occasionally
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with desired toppings

data.title: Vegan Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
data.description: Simple Italian pasta with garlic, olive oil, and chili flakes, made vegan
ingredients: 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes (or more to taste)
Salt and black pepper to taste
Optional: Vegan Parmesan cheese, nutritional yeast
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Reserve about 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining
While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add the sliced garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the garlic is fragrant and lightly golden. Be careful not to burn the garlic
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet along with about 1/4 cup of the reserved pasta water. Toss to combine, adding more pasta water if needed to create a light sauce
Stir in the chopped parsley. Season with salt and black pepper to taste
Serve immediately. Top with vegan Parmesan cheese or nutritional yeast, if desired

data.title: Hummus
data.description: Middle Eastern spread made from blended chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon
ingredients: 1 (15oz) can chickpeas, drained or 1 1/5 cups (250g) cooked chickpeas
1/4 cup (60ml) fresh lemon juice, 1 large lemon
2 tablespoons (30ml) extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving
2 to 3 tablespoons (45ml) cold water or aquafaba
Dash ground paprika, sumac, or Za'atar for serving
instructions: Place the chickpeas in a medium saucepan and add the baking soda. Cover the chickpeas by several inches of water, then bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Continue boiling, reducing heat if necessary to prevent overflow, for about 20 minutes, or until the chickpeas look bloated, their skins are falling off, and they’re quite soft. In a fine-mesh strainer, drain the chickpeas and run cool water over them for about 30 seconds. Set aside

Meanwhile, in a food processor or high-powered blender, combine the lemon juice, garlic and salt. Process until the garlic is very finely chopped, then let the mixture rest so the garlic flavor can mellow, ideally 10 minutes or longer
Add the tahini to the food processor and blend until the mixture is thick and creamy, stopping to scrape down any tahini stuck to the sides and bottom of the processor as necessary

While running the food processor, drizzle in 2 tablespoons ice water. Scrape down the food processor, and blend until the mixture is ultra smooth, pale and creamy. (If your tahini was extra-thick to begin with, you might need to add 1 to 2 tablespoons more ice water.)

Add the cumin and the drained, over-cooked chickpeas to the food processor. While blending, drizzle in the olive oil. Blend until the mixture is super smooth, scraping down the sides of the processor as necessary, about 2 minutes. Add more ice water by the tablespoon if necessary to achieve a super creamy texture
Taste, and adjust as necessary—I almost always add another ¼ teaspoon salt for more overall flavor and another tablespoon of lemon juice for extra zing

Scrape the hummus into a serving bowl or platter, and use a spoon to create nice swooshes on top. Top with garnishes of your choice, and serve. Leftover hummus keeps well in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 1 week

data.title: Mâncare de Praz cu Măsline
data.description: Leek Stew with Olives
ingredients: 1 cup green olives, pitted and halved
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until translucent
Add sliced leeks to the pot, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes
Add green olives, dried thyme, dried oregano, and bay leaf. Stir to combine
Pour in 4 cups of water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let it simmer for 30 minutes
Season with salt, pepper, lemon zest, and lemon juice
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley

data.title: Artichoke & pea stew
data.description: Whipped pea stew with new potatoes
ingredients: 1 cup canned artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1 pound new potatoes, boiled and halved
instructions: In a food processor, combine peas, artichoke hearts, za'atar, olive oil, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve the whipped mixture alongside boiled new potatoes
Garnish with fresh mint leaves

data.title: Pesto alla Genovese
data.description: Italian sauce made from basil, garlic, pine nuts, Parmesan, and olive oil
ingredients: 1/4 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
instructions: In a food processor, combine basil leaves, pine nuts, and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped
With the processor running, slowly drizzle in olive oil until the mixture is smooth
Transfer the pesto to a bowl and mix in the grated Parmesan and Pecorino cheeses
Season with salt to taste
Toss with your choice of pasta and serve immediately

data.title: Tlayudas Oaxaqueñas
data.description: Oaxacan flatbread topped with refried beans, cheese, and grilled meat or vegetables
instructions: Preheat a large skillet over medium heat
Place each tortilla in the skillet, cooking for about 2 minutes on each side until slightly crispy
Spread a thin layer of refried black beans on each tortilla
Sprinkle shredded Oaxaca cheese and crumbled chorizo over the beans
Transfer the tortillas to a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted
Remove from the oven and top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, pickled red onions, avocado slices, and a drizzle of hot sauce
Serve immediately

data.title: Broccoli Soup & Cheesy Soldiers
data.description: Creamy broccoli soup served with toasted cheese-topped bread sticks
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautéing until softened
Add broccoli florets and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes or until broccoli is tender
Use an immersion blender to purée the soup until smooth. Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted
Toast the whole-grain bread and butter each slice. Top with shredded cheddar cheese and toast until melted and bubbly
Serve the soup with the cheesy soldiers on the side

data.title: Vegan Sushi Rolls
data.description: Plant-based sushi rolls filled with vegetables and avocado, wrapped in nori
instructions: Rinse sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Cook rice with water in a rice cooker according to instructions
Once cooked, combine rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl. Stir into the rice and allow to cool
Lay out a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top
Place cucumber, avocado, and carrot along the bottom edge of the rice
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat. Seal the edge with a bit of water
Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces. Serve with soy sauce for dipping

data.title: Shakshuka
data.description: North African breakfast dish made with poached eggs in a spiced tomato sauce
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add onion and red bell pepper, cooking until softened
Stir in garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili powder, cooking for 1 minute
Add the canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken
Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them, cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are set
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with crusty bread

data.title: Sushi Rolls with Tofu
data.description: Vegan sushi rolls with tofu, cucumber, and carrot for a light and healthy meal
ingredients: 1/2 block firm tofu, sliced into strips
instructions: Rinse sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear, then cook the rice with water
Once cooked, stir in rice vinegar, sugar, and salt, then let it cool
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat, spread rice over it leaving a border at the top
Place tofu, cucumber, and carrot along the bottom edge
Roll tightly, seal with water, and slice into bite-sized pieces
Serve with soy sauce

data.title: Vegan Lentil Stew
data.description: A hearty and healthy vegan lentil stew full of earthy spices and vegetables
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat, adding onion, carrots, celery, and garlic
Cook for 5 minutes until vegetables soften
Add lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, cumin, and coriander, bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste

data.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
data.description: A simple yet delicious pizza with fresh mozzarella, tomato sauce, and basil
instructions: Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C)
Roll out pizza dough and transfer it to a baking sheet
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, then top with mozzarella slices
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden
Remove from the oven, drizzle with olive oil, and garnish with fresh basil leaves

data.title: Vegan Chickpea Curry
data.description: A creamy and flavorful chickpea curry made with coconut milk and spices
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a large pan over medium heat
Add onion, garlic, and ginger, cooking until the onion is softened
Stir in curry powder and turmeric, cooking for 1 minute
Add chickpeas, coconut milk, and diced tomatoes, simmer for 15 minutes
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh cilantro

data.title: Baked Falafel
data.description: Crispy baked falafel with a blend of fresh herbs and spices, perfect for a healthy meal
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C)
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, and baking powder
Pulse until the mixture is smooth but still has some texture
Add flour and pulse until combined, then season with salt and pepper
Form the mixture into small balls and place them on a baking sheet
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through

data.title: Kimchi Jjigae
data.description: A comforting Korean stew made with fermented kimchi, tofu, and gochujang
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a pot over medium heat
Add onion and garlic, sautéing until softened
Stir in kimchi, tofu, vegetable broth, gochujang, soy sauce, and ginger
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes
Garnish with green onions and serve

data.title: Mushroom Risotto
data.description: A creamy Italian risotto with earthy mushrooms and Parmesan cheese
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Add onion and garlic, cooking until softened
Stir in Arborio rice, cooking for 2 minutes until lightly toasted
Add white wine and cook until mostly absorbed
Gradually add vegetable broth, one cup at a time, stirring frequently until rice is tender
Stir in mushrooms and Parmesan, cooking for 2 more minutes

data.title: Gado-Gado
data.description: A traditional Indonesian salad made of boiled vegetables, rice cakes, tofu, and a rich peanut sauce
instructions: Arrange the boiled potatoes, eggs, cabbage, cucumber, spinach, tofu, and tempeh in a large bowl
Whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and chili paste to make the sauce
Pour the peanut sauce over the vegetables and tofu, and toss to combine
Serve chilled or at room temperature

data.title: Falafel with Hummus
data.description: A Middle Eastern dish of crispy chickpea balls served with creamy hummus
instructions: Soak chickpeas in water for 24 hours, then drain and rinse
Pulse the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, and coriander in a food processor until a coarse paste forms
Add baking powder, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper, and mix well
Shape into small balls or patties, then fry in hot oil until golden and crispy
Serve with hummus on the side

data.title: Vegan Tacos
data.description: Flavorful vegan tacos filled with spiced lentils and topped with avocado, cilantro, and lime
instructions: Cook the lentils according to package instructions, then drain
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until soft
Add cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, and tomatoes, cooking for 5 minutes
Stir in the lentils and lime juice, then season with salt and pepper
Fill taco shells with the lentil mixture, then top with avocado and cilantro

data.title: Banh Mi
data.description: A Vietnamese sandwich with crispy baguette, pickled vegetables, cilantro, and a variety of fillings
instructions: Split the baguettes and spread mayonnaise on one side
Drizzle soy sauce and hoisin sauce on the other side
Layer cucumber, pickled carrots, daikon, cilantro, and grilled tofu
Top with sriracha and close the sandwich

data.title: Ratatouille
data.description: A French vegetable medley of eggplant, zucchini, and peppers, cooked slowly in a tomato sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
Layer sliced vegetables in a baking dish
In a separate bowl, mix chopped tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, thyme, basil, salt, and pepper
Pour the tomato mixture over the vegetables and bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender

data.title: Lentil Curry
data.description: A warming Indian curry made with lentils, tomatoes, and a blend of spices
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened
Add curry powder, cumin, turmeric, and tomatoes, cooking for 5 minutes
Stir in lentils and vegetable broth, bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender
Season with salt and pepper

data.title: Chana Masala
data.description: A flavorful North Indian chickpea curry cooked with tomatoes, onions, and spices
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened
Add cumin, coriander, and garam masala, cooking for 1 minute
Add chickpeas, tomatoes, water, and turmeric, simmering for 20 minutes
Season with salt to taste
